Gets the details of the issue Attachment for an API specified by its identifier.

Azure REST API version: 2022-09-01-preview.

Other available API versions: 2022-08-01, 2024-06-01-preview.

These versions are not included in the SDK but you can generate them as a local SDK package; see the [version guide](../../../version-guide/#accessing-any-api-version-via-local-packages) for details.




## Using getApiIssueAttachment {#using}

Two invocation forms are available. The direct form accepts plain
arguments and either blocks until the result value is available, or
returns a Promise-wrapped result. The output form accepts
Input-wrapped arguments and returns an Output-wrapped result.

            title="">
        <span id="contentformat_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#contentformat_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Content<wbr>Format</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Either 'link' if content is provided via an HTTP link or the MIME type of the Base64-encoded binary data provided in the 'content' property.</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="id_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#id_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="name_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#name_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>The name of the resource</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="title_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#title_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Title</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Filename by which the binary data will be saved.</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="type_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#type_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Type</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>The type of the resource. E.g. &quot;Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines&quot; or &quot;Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts&quot;</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
